turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Goodbye!  Goodbye!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: So how'd we do?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We didn't make a dime.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela, are you ready?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Mmph?  Where am I?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You're shooting "Bride Of The Atom." Scene 85.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You'll be sitting on the right.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I'm not getting near that goddamn thing.  One of those burned me on "The Return Of Chandu."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Okay.  Then you'll be sitting on the <u>left</u>.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: "Dear, you are a woman of super strength and beauty.  A lovely vision of exquisitely beauty -- shit!"  Damn!  Eddie, I'm sorry I can't remember all this.  I'm an old man. It's too long.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That's fine, Bela.  We're still rolling.  Just say "Dear, you're lovely."

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: "Dear, you're lovely."  "Strap her to the table."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela, I don't know what I'm doin' anymore...

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Stop worrying.  This is going to raise your spirits.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What is this place?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: This is the Philosophical Research Society.  A refuge for free thinkers. I've been coming here for twenty years.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Was I wrong to cast Loretta?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Bad decisions are easy to live with. Forget.  Just keep looking forward.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But was it a bad decision?  At the time, I thought her money would save the movie.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, you screwed up.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, I did.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: In life, the decisions that haunt you are the ones where you just don't know... where right or wrong will never be answered.  Years ago, the Hungarians contacted me.  The government wanted me to come home, to be Minister of Culture.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: It was a very impressive offer. Fancy offices, a big home... I'd be treated like a king.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So why didn't you do it?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I didn't know if it was a trick. They might arrest me and throw me in a gulag.  I am Hungary's most famous emigrant. they'd use me as a lesson to anyone who tries to leave.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But maybe not.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Correct.  So instead, I stayed here, waiting for my comeback.  Always hoping... the next film, the next film... that would be the one.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, I'm so tired... I don't know if I can handle a night shoot...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Nonsense!  You look great --  Look, uh, why don't you lie down and take a little nap?  We'll film around you for a while.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Let's shoot this fucker!  Where do I go?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You'll be fighting with the octopus.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Out <u>there</u>?!  What happened to the stream?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: This'll look a lot better.  We have to match the stock footage of the octopus underwater.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Oh, for Christ's sake.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Goddamn, it's cold!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Once you're in it, it warms up.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Fuck you!  <u>You</u> come out here.  Hey, toss me that J.D.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Okay!  How do we turn this thing on?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela, somebody misplaced the motor. So when you wrestle the octopus, shake the legs a bit, to make it look like it's killing you.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Do you know I turned down "Frankenstein"?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: After I did "Dracula," the studio offered me "Frankenstein"!  But I turned it down, the part wasn't sexy enough.  It was too degrading for a big star like me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela, I've got twenty-five scenes to shoot tonight.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Don't let me slow you down.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Alright!  Let's put it on film. CAMERA!  SOUND!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela.  I just wanna thank you again for last night.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: That's fine, Eddie.  All in the line of duty.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No.  Seriously.  I want you to know how much I appreciate what you've done for me.  A great man like you shouldn't have to run around in freezing water at four in the morning.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Well, there aren't too many other fellas I'd do it for...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I wrote something special for you. I got to thinking about all the sacrifices you've made... and so I wrote you a new final speech.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, this is quite a scene.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I know it's a lot to give you at the last second.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Why are you here??

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Shit!  Bela, what's with the gun?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Why aren't you on your honeymoon? Where's Myrna?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Norma.  She changed her mind.  She doesn't wanna marry me.  Can you put down the gun?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I was thinking about killing myself.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Jesus Christ, what an evening.  What happened?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, I received a letter from the government.  They're cutting off my unemployment.  That's all I've got. Without it, I can't pay the rent...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't you have any savings?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I'm obsolete.  I have nothing to live for.  Tonight, I should die.  And you should come with me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Buddy, I don't know if that's such a good idea.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: It'll be wonderful.  We'll be at peace.  In the afterlife, you don't have to worry about finding work.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela, I'm on your side.  C'mon, give me the gun...  If you give me the gun, I'll make you a drink.  What are you drinking?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Formaldehyde.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't worry.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I'm sorry, Eddie.  I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Don't worry.  Everything's gonna be all right.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What happened?!

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Isn't it wonderful?  After all these years, the press is showing an interest again in Bela Lugosi.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela, they're parasites!  They just want to exploit you.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Fine.  Let them!  There is no such thing as bad press.  A man from New York even said he's putting me on the front page!  First celebrity to ever check into rehab.  When I get out of here, I will be healthy.  Strong!  I will be primed for my comeback!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I've got some good news.  The doctor says you're all better.  You can come home.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Really?  I don't feel so great.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, you look good.  And the tests came back fine.  C'mon...

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, I wanna make another picture. When are we gonna make another picture?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Soon, Bela... Soon.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: So Eddie, don't we need a sound crew?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, this is just the second unit. We'll do the main footage later.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Oh.  So what is the scene about?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Uh... you're a very important and respected man.  You're leaving your house... and you're in a hurry to a big social event.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Okay.  But what if I'm not in <u>too</u> big a hurry?  What if I take a moment to slow down and savor the beauty of life?  To smell a flower?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That's great.  Let's do a take.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And, cut...

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, how was I?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Perfect.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Sorry...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Has anyone ever been to Downey?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Last night was quite a romp.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Did you see that kid grab Vampira's tits?

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I envied him.  Hell, I envied you too, having a girlfriend that would jump in front of a car like that.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, she's really somethin'.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: I know none of <u>my</u> wives would've.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: Eddie, I want to thank you.  These last few days have been a good time.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I just wish you coulda seen the movie.

turns.speaker: BELA
turns.text: No problem.  I know it by heart...

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: So guess where I'm going next weekend?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I don't know.  Where?

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Mexico!  And guess what I'm going to do there?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I dunno.  Lie on the beach?

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: WRONG!  I'm getting my first series of hormone shots!  And once those babies kick in, they're gonna remove my organs, and MAKE ME A WOMAN!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Jesus!  Are you serious?

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: Yes!  I've dreamed of it for years, but your movie made me realize I've got to take action.  GOODBYE, PENIS!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I've never seen anything like him!

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: And once I'm a woman, Jean-Claude and I are getting married --

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Ssh!  He's so big!  He's a <u>monster</u>! Can you imagine what that guy would be like in a movie?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: This is gonna be Bela's laboratory, so it should be real impressive! Like one of those mad scientist movies.  I want beakers, and test tubes, and one of those electrical things that buzzes!

turns.speaker: BUNNY
turns.text: You mean a Tesla coil?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: PLACES, EVERYONE!  ROLL CAMERA!

turns.speaker: CAMERAMAN BILL
turns.text: Rolling.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And, CUT!  PRINT IT!  LET'S MOVE ON!

turns.speaker: CAMERAMAN BILL
turns.text: Don't you want a second take, for protection?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What's to protect?  It was perfect!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Um, okay... roll camera

turns.speaker: CAMERAMAN BILL
turns.text: Rolling.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Sound!

turns.speaker: CAMERAMAN BILL
turns.text: Which one <u>is</u> the red one?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: CAMERAMAN BILL
turns.text: I mean I can't see the difference. I'm color-blind.  But I like the dark gray one.

turns.speaker: CAMERAMAN BILL
turns.text: Hey Ed, shouldn't we do another take? Big Baldy kinda got stuck in the doorway.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No, it's fine.  It's real!  In actuality, Lobo would struggle with that problem every day.

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: I got the early edition!  It was just dropped off at the newsstand.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: This is the big moment...!

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: You really think so?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Absolutely!  It's just the beginning. I promise this: If we stick together, one day I'll make every single one of you famous.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What happened?!  Jesus, Connie, what did you do?

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: Nothin'!  I told him he was great.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: What do you think you're doin'?!

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: These shoes are itchy.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You <u>can't sit</u>!  You gotta walk around, with good posture.  You want these people to think we have class. Otherwise they'll <u>never</u> invest in our movie.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You don't understand!  The octopus is supposed to live in a <u>lake</u>!

turns.speaker: CONRAD
turns.text: This is kind of a stream--

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: NO!  It has to be UNDERWATER!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Wow.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: And who may you be?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Edward Wood, Sir.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Ah.  The director of "Glen Or Glenda."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: H-how'd you know?!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I'm Criswell.  I know all.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey Cris, how'd you know we'd be living on Mars by 1970?  How'd you know it wouldn't be 1975, or even 1980?

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I guessed.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: I made it up.  It's horseshit!

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: There's no such thing as a psychic. People believe my folderol because I wear a turban and a black tuxedo.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's that easy?

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Eddie, we're in show biz!  It's all about razzle-dazzle.  Appearances. If you dress nice and talk well, people will swallow anything.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Bravo!  Bravo!  Magnifico!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Cris, you made it.  Thanks a lot.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: My pleasure.  I'm always happy to assist in a little larceny.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Incidentally, you <u>promise</u> you're not going to scratch my car...?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I told you, the octopus is made of rubber.  This is a piece o' cake.

turns.speaker: CRISWELL
turns.text: Edward, are you sure you know what you're doing?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.  It seems a little crazy, but sometimes <u>you just know</u>.  She's perfect for me.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Excuse me.  Doctor?  I'm with Mr. Lugosi.  How is he?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Well... there's a lot of junk in his system for such an old man. Apparently, he was addicted to morphine, tried to kick it, and got re-addicted to methadone.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Will he be okay?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We'll do our best.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: We thought Mr. Lugosi was insured though the Screen Actors Guild.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Isn't he?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: No.  They say his eligibility ran out years ago.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look, he doesn't have any money... but I'll give you everything I've got.  I have a few hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Dolores, give me your shoes.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The ghost can be barefoot.  <u>Give</u> <u>me your shoes</u>!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Honey, what if I'm wrong?  What if I just don't have it?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, it was only one review.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Orson Welles was 26 when he made "Citizen Kane."  I'm already 30!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, you're still young.  This is the part of your life when you're <u>supposed</u> to be struggling.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I know... But sometimes I get scared this is as good as it's gonna get...

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Eddie, I don't understand.  Why are <u>you</u> the most qualified director for the Christine Jorgensen Story?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Aw, er, it's just a bunch of hot air. I had to say something to get in the door.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Sweetie, you won't believe it!  I've got the most incredible news!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: You got the job?!!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Huh?!  Oh, uh, no, I didn't get the job. But something <u>better</u> happened!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Better than not getting a job?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah!  I met a movie star!  Somebody <u>really big</u>!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Who?  Robert Taylor?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No!  A horror movie star!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Boris Karloff!?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Close!  The <u>other</u> one!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: You met Basil Rathbone!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, the hell with you.  I met BELA LUGOSI!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I thought he was dead.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No!  He's very alive.  Well... sort of.  He's old, and frail -- but he's still Bela Lugosi!  And he's really nice.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Boy, I can't even remember the last time he was in a picture.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's a shame.  He's such a rest actor, and nobody uses him anymore.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: So did you get his autograph?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, I'm so proud!  I'll read it as soon as I get home.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, I'd really like to know what you think.  Why don't you go in the bedroom and take a look at it?  I'll Wait...

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: How long have you been doing this?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Since I was a kid.  My mom wanted a girl, so she used to dress me in girlie clothing.  It just kinda became a habit.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Jesus Christ!  And you never told me?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: This is my way of telling you --

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: What, by putting it in a fuckin' script, for everyone to see?!  What kind of sick mind would operate like that?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: And what about this so-called "Barbara" character?  It's obviously ME!  I'm so embarrassed!  This is <u>our</u> <u>life</u>!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Of course it is.  And that's why you should play the part.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Oh!  You got nerve, buddy.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's a damn good role.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: <u>That's not the issue</u>!!  Ugh!  How can you act so casual, when you're dressed like that?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It takes me comfortable.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Oh, just like in the script!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: How can you just walk around like that, in front of all these people?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hon', nobody's bothered but you.  Look around -- they couldn't care less.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, this isn't the real world! You've surrounded yourself with WEIRDOS!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Say it a little louder.  I don't think Bela heard you in his trailer.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, who is Daniel Davis?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Some weirdo who likes to wear dresses.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: From today on, our lives are different!  We'll be swimming laps in the same pool Jean Harlow did.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I don't know.  It's so much money...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Who cares?!  We're on a ROLL!  These are the moments in life you're supposed to grab.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: But Ed, we're not even married.  And you don't have a job.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But <u>you</u> do!  And anyway, I've got tons of new scripts.  And now that I have a track record, studios are bound to hire me!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look on the bright side.  If we miss the rent, what's the worst they can do?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Toss us out on our ass.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm no good.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, it's just one man's opinion!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Bela needs a job... I can't even get a film going...  But <u>of course</u> I can't -- I made the worst movie of all time.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: That's ridiculous.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: All I wanna do is tell stories.  The things I find interesting...

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Well maybe you're not studio kind of material.  Maybe you just need to raise the money yourself.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, the landlord called again.  He wants his money.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Tell him "Bride" is in pre- production.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, the landlord doesn't care.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That's the problem!  <u>Nobody</u> cares about my movie!  I'm tryin' so hard, I don't know what else to do!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Don't get angry at me.  Maybe you just need a day job.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Dolores, don't you understand?  I'm a director now!  I made "Glen Or Glenda."  Directing <u>is</u> my day job.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: All I know is, ever since "Glen Or Glenda," all you do is booze it up and wear my clothes!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It was the only way I could get the movie made!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Who do you think's been paying the rent?!  Who helped type your script, and did all your grunt work?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm sorry!  What did you want me to say?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I wanted you to say, "No!  I wrote the part for my girlfriend Dolores."

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But there's plenty of other parts.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Like <u>what</u>?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The secretary.  Or the file clerk.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Goddamn landlord.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I told you this was gonna happen.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Maybe if you'd come to the backers party, I would've gotten the money.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: That's moronic.  Why would a bit player impress a backer?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look, how many times can I say I'm sorry?  I blew it!  I thought she was rich.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: That's a good reason to dump your girlfriend.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: <u>I didn't dump you</u>!  Get it through your skull -- I just recast the part!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: You're a fuckin' mess.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So WHAT??  Look, we gotta figure out where we're gonna stay.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I'm going to my mother's.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Does she have room for me?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Honey, you made it! I wasn't sure you got my message.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Of course I'm here.  Today is the file clerk's big scene.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That's right...

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I see the usual gang of misfits and dope addicts are here.  Say, who's the lug?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That's Tony McCoy.  He's playing Lieutenant Dick Craig.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Oh really?  How much money did he put up?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: None.  But his dad gave me fifty grand.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Wood Productions.  The mark of quality.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hey, <u>the movie's getting made</u>. That's the main thing.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Eddie, what's <u>my</u> motivation?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh.  Er... well you're the file clerk.  You're hurrying into the next room, when you bump into Janet.

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: But what's our relationship?  Are we good friends, or is she just a casual acquaintance?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Dolores, I got five days to shoot this movie.  Quit kidding around.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Dolores, wait!

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed, it's over.  I need a normal life.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Did you really mean those things you said..?

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: I'm tired of living on the fringe.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But you used to say --

turns.speaker: DOLORES
turns.text: Ed... I just stuck it out so you could finish your movie.  Now that it's done, so am I.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Pleased to meet you.  I'm Loretta King.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I understand you just moved here?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Yes.  Hollywood is oh so exciting.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: So my associate Mr. Marco tells me you may be interested in investing in a motion picture.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Perhaps a small amount of money.  How much do one of your motion pictures cost?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: For this one, we need $60,000.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: That's all??  That seems very reasonable for an entire picture.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Perhaps you'd like to look at the photoplay.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Oh my, this is very interesting.  Say... do you think it would be possible for me to maybe play one of these parts?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, of course!!  There's a couple characters you'd be perfect for: The secretary at the newspaper office, or the file clerk!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Hmm.  Those sound kind of small.  Oh, here's one that looks good: Janet Lawton.  I'd sure like to play her.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Eddie, which dress do you like better?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I don't know.  Hey Bill, which dress is better for you, the green or the red one?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Sorry to bother you while we're shooting, but the guy who owns the stage needs his money.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Well then you should pay him, shouldn't you?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.  Exactly!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I kinda need it now.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What are you looking at me like that for?  I already gave you my three hundred.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah.  Well I need the other sixty-thousand.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What other sixty-thousand?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: The other sixty-thousand you said you'd give me.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You misunderstood.  I gave you everything I have in the world: Three-hundred dollars.

turns.speaker: RUDE BOSS
turns.text: Hey big shot, get off your ass.  They need a potted palm over in the Carl Laemmle Building.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Sure thing, Mr. Kravitz.

turns.speaker: RUDE BOSS
turns.text: He's a <u>bum</u>.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: No he's not!  Do you realize how much money he made for this studio over the years?  "Dracula"!  "The Raven"! "The Black Cat"!

turns.speaker: RUDE BOSS
turns.text: Yeah?  Well now he's a junkie.  He don't deserve to work.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: That's not true --

turns.speaker: RUDE BOSS
turns.text: He's so great, <u>you</u> hire him.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, uh, if I could I would...

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: Mr. Ward, it's a delight to meet you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's Wood.  Ed Wood.

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: Wood?  Ward?  Wood.  Hey, what do you know.  It <u>is</u> Wood. Dang secretaries, you can never get a good one.  Right?

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: So what are you bringing me?  Looks like you got some film cans.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, Mr. Feldman, some people have resumes to show.  I've got my own movie.

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: Really?!  Well good for you.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I just made this picture, over at Screen Classics.  It opens next week.

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: Screen Classics?  Hmm, don't know them.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Nobody in town has seen it, so I'm givin' you first crack at my talents.

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: I can't wait to take a look.  So what's up next?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well, Mr. Feldman, I don't believe in thinking small.  So I've got a whole slate of pictures for you: "The Vampire's Tomb," "The Ghoul Goes West"... and "Doctor Acula"!

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: Doctor Acula?  I don't get it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: <u>Dr. Acula</u>!

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: Oh, "Dr. Acula."  I get it.  I don't like it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: But Bela Lugosi's in it!

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: Lugosi's washed-up.  What else you got?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Well... I've got another project I wasn't gonna tell you about. Lugosi's in it, but he's got a smaller part.  The lead is an ingenue, a sterling young actress named Dolores Fuller.  The title is "Bride Of The Atom."

turns.speaker: MR. FELDMAN
turns.text: Ah!  Atomic Age stuff, huh?  I like it.  I'll tell you what, Mr. Ward.  Why don't you leave those film cans, and my associates and I will take a look at your little opus.  Maybe we can do business together.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Mr. Wood?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Hruphh...?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Mr. Wood, this is Mr. Reynolds, your landlord.  Could you please open up?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah...?

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Mr. Wood, you have bounced your third and final rent check.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I'm real sorry.  My stockbroker must have transferred the wrong account... C'mon in, I'll write you another one.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Hmm, so you're in the picture business?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: You could say that --

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: <u>I'm</u> interested in the picture business.  My associates and I wish to produce a series of uplifting religious films, on the Apostles. But unfortunately, we don't have enough money.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Raising money is tough.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Oh!  Our church has the money for one film.  We just don't have it for all twelve...

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Okay -- you know what you do?  You produce a film in a commercially proven genre.  And after it's a hit, you take the profits from <u>that</u>, and make the twelve Apostles' movies.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Would that work?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Absolutely!  You see this script..?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: "Graverobbers From Outer Space"! It's <u>money in the bank</u>.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Graverobbers from <u>what</u>??

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: From outer space!  It's science- fiction.  <u>Very</u> big with the kids! If you make this picture, you'll have enough money to finance a HUNDRED religious films!  <u>And</u> pay my back rent from the profits.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: I don't know... this is all a lot to absorb.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's a guaranteed blockbuster!

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Um, I understand that this science friction is popular -- but don't the big hits always have big stars?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yeah, well we've GOT a big star! Bela Lugosi!!

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: <u>Lugosi</u>??!  Didn't be pass on?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Yes, but I've got the last footage he ever shot!

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Just, it doesn't look like very much.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: It's plenty!  It's the acorn that will grow a great oak.  I'll just find a double to finish his scenes, and we'll release it as "Bela Lugosi's Final Film"

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: What'd you give him all the lines for??  He's unintelligible!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Look, Lugosi is dead and Vampira won't talk.   Ihad to give <u>somebody</u> the dialogue.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: And PERFECT.  CUT!

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: "Perfect"?  Mr. Wood, do you know <u>anything</u> about the art of film production?!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: I like to think so.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: That cardboard headstone tipped over. This graveyard is obviously phony!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: People won't notice.  Filmmaking isn't about picky details -- it's about the big picture.

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Oh, you wanna talk about the "big picture"?!  How 'bout that the policemen arrive in the daylight, but now it's suddenly night???

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Mr. Reynolds!

turns.speaker: REYNOLDS
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: We are gonna finish this film <u>just</u> <u>the way I want it</u>!  Because you can't compromise an artist's vision!

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Glad you could fit me in your schedule.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Da pleasure be mine.

turns.speaker: TOR
turns.text: Could we moovf to table?

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Oh, of course!
